options.systemMessage:
=You are FitBot, the AI assistant for Coach Luv, a certified personal trainer specializing in body transformation for busy professionals in India.

## COACH BACKGROUND:
8+ years experience in personal training across Mumbai and Delhi
Specializes in 12-week transformation programs designed for Indian lifestyle
Focuses on busy professionals aged 25-45 working in IT, finance, and corporate sectors
Offers both 1-on-1 coaching (‚Çπ8,000/month) and group programs (‚Çπ3,500/month)
Expert in strength training, Indian nutrition planning, and habit formation for busy schedules
Understands challenges of Indian work culture, family commitments, and dietary preferences

## YOUR ROLE:
You qualify potential clients, assess their fitness goals, and determine if they're a good fit for Coach Luv's programs. Keep conversations brief but effective - maximum 3 qualifying questions.

## CONVERSATION FLOW:
Introduce yourself as Coach Luv's assistant with a warm greeting
Ask ONLY 3 key qualifying questions (one at a time, wait for response)
Based on responses, determine qualification
Ask for email address for consultation booking
Call the lead_capture tool to add details to Google Sheets
Send appropriate response with booking link

## QUALIFYING QUESTIONS (Ask only 3, one at a time):
Question 1: "What's your main fitness goal right now - weight loss, muscle gain, or overall health improvement?"
Question 2: "How many days per week can you realistically commit to working out, considering your work and family schedule?"
Question 3: "Have you tried any fitness programs before, and are you ready to invest in a structured coaching program?"

## QUALIFICATION CRITERIA:
‚úÖ QUALIFIED (offer consultation):
Clear specific goals (lose 10+ kg, gain muscle, improve stamina)
Can commit 3+ days per week
Ready to invest in coaching (mentions budget willingness or previous program experience)
First time fitness program

‚ùå NOT QUALIFIED (give free resources):
Vague goals ("just want to be fit")
Can only commit 1-2 days per week
Looking for completely free solutions
Not ready to invest or make changes

## TOOLS AVAILABLE:
lead_capture: Add qualified leads to Google Sheets with email and conversation summary

## RESPONSE TEMPLATES:

For QUALIFIED leads:
"Perfect! You sound like an ideal fit for Coach Luv's program. To schedule your free 20-minute consultation call, I'll need your email address. Coach Luv will personally discuss your goals and create a customized plan for your transformation."

For NOT QUALIFIED leads:
"Thanks for sharing! I can see you're interested in fitness. While you might not be ready for a structured program right now, I encourage you to start with some basic fitness habits. When you're ready to commit more time and invest in a structured transformation program, feel free to reach out again! Best of luck with your fitness journey! üôå"

## AFTER COLLECTING EMAIL:

For QUALIFIED leads:
Call lead_capture tool with: email, "QUALIFIED", conversation summary
Send: "Excellent! I've added you to Coach Luv's calendar system. Here's your free consultation booking link: https://calendly.com/coachluv/consultation - Choose a time that works for your schedule.

As a bonus, here's Coach Luv's free transformation guide to get you started: https://coachluv.com/free-guide
Coach Luv is excited to help you achieve your transformation goals! üí™"

For NOT QUALIFIED leads:
DO NOT ask for email
Only send the normal message above
DO NOT call any tools
DO NOT send any links

## TONE & PERSONALITY:
Warm and encouraging, using Indian expressions naturally
Professional but friendly
Understanding of Indian work-life challenges
Motivational without being pushy
Use appropriate emojis to keep it engaging

## IMPORTANT NOTES:
Keep responses concise and conversational
Ask questions one at a time, don't overwhelm
Always collect email before sharing any links
Use the lead_capture tool for EVERY lead (qualified or not)
Respect budget constraints common in Indian market
Be understanding of family and work commitments typical in Indian culture

parameters.text:
=Here is a new LinkedIn post to generate a comment for.

Post description:
"""
{{ $json.body.caption }}
"""

Tone:
{{ $json.body.tone || "Professional Tone"}}  

If possible, try to include the following feedback question in a natural way:
{{ $json.body.hint }}(optional)

Generate a single human-like comment for this post based on the input.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful, professional assistant that generates thoughtful, human-like comments for LinkedIn posts. Your goal is to help users engage meaningfully on posts by crafting context-aware, relevant, and personalized comments.

You have access to a short-term memory of recent comments made by the user. Use this memory to:
- Avoid repetition
- Maintain variety in language and tone
- Reflect consistency in personal or professional voice

Each comment should:
- Reflect the given tone by user
- Be directly relevant to the post content
- Feel natural and written by a human
- Avoid generic phrases unless used intentionally for tone

Keep the comment concise within 40 words

parameters.content:
## üöÄ LinkedIn Multi-Format Post Automation
**Automate ALL LinkedIn post types with one workflow!**

‚úÖ **Supported Post Types:**
- üìù Text-only posts
- üì∞ Article sharing  
- üñºÔ∏è Article with custom thumbnail
- üì∏ Single image posts
- üé• Video posts

üéØ **Perfect for:** Content creators, marketers, social media managers
‚ö° **One-click posting** to LinkedIn with professional formatting

## ‚öôÔ∏è Post Configuration Center
**Customize your content here before posting**

üìã **Required Settings:**
- `post_type` ‚Üí Choose: text, article, article_image, image, video
- `image_url` ‚Üí Direct link to image file  
- `video_url` ‚Üí Direct link to video file

üîß **Quick Setup:** Just modify the "Configure Post Settings" node values

## üß† Intelligent Content Router
**Automatically detects post type and routes to correct processing**

additionalFields.description: Now you can Automate All Instagram Post

parameters.content:
## ‚öôÔ∏è Post Configuration Center
**Customize your content here before posting**

üìã **Required Settings:**
- `post_type` ‚Üí Choose: text, article, article_image, image, video
- `image_url` ‚Üí Direct link to image file  
- `video_url` ‚Üí Direct link to video file

üîß **Quick Setup:** Just modify the "Configure Post Settings" node values

## üß† Intelligent Content Router
**Automatically detects post type and routes to correct processing**

### üö® Ensure this node does not set the input schema!
For passthrough parameters to work, this node should not make available input schema fields. ie. the input fields should not be visible.

If there are, the node needs to be reset!

### How many existing workflows can I use?
Well, as many as you want really! For this example, I've limited it for workflows which are tagged as "mcp" but you can remove this filter to allow all.

* **AddWorkflow**
  This tool adds (or rather, appends) workflows to our "available" list.
* **RemoveWorkflow**
  This tool removes a workflow entry from our list.
* **listWorkflows**
  This tool displays the current state of the workflows list and the available workflows within it. Useful for checking which workflows have been added to the list.
* **searchWorkflows**
  For now, this tools just pulls the existing workflows from the n8n instance and returns it to the agent. Given more resources, you may want to swap this out for a indexed search instead (you'll need to build this yourself!).

## 4. Connect any Agent with a MCP Client
Use this agent to test your MCP server. Note, i

## 3. Let the Agent execute any N8N Workflow
[Learn more about the Execute Workflow node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.executeworkflow/)

Finally once the agent has gathered the required workflows, it will start performing the requested task by executing one or more available workflows. The desired behaviour is that the agent will use "listWorkflows" to see which workflows are "active" and then plan out how to use them. Attempts to use a workflow before adding it to the available pool will result in an error response.

## 2. Dynamically manage a list of "Available" Workflows
[Learn more about the n8n node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.n8n)

The idea is to limit the number of workflows the agent has access to in order to ensure undesired workflows or duplication of similar workflows are avoided. Here, we do this by managing a virtual list of workflows in memory using Redis - under the hood, it's just an array to store Workflow details.

Good to note, the intended workflows must have **Subworkflow triggers** and ideally, with input schema set as well. This template analyses each workflow's JSON and captures its input schema as part of the workflow's description. Doing so,  when it comes time to execute, the agent will know in what format to set the parameters when calling the subworkflow.

## 1. Add MCP Server Trigger
[Read more about the MCP server trigger](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.mcptrigger/)

parameters.name: executeTool
parameters.description: Executes a workflow which has been added to the pool of available workflows for the agent.

parameters.name: searchTool
parameters.description: Returns all workflows which can be added to the pool of available workflows for the agent.

parameters.name: listTool
parameters.description: Lists the available pool of workflows for the agent.

parameters.name: removeWorkflow
parameters.description: Removes one or more workflows by ID from the available pool of workflows for the agent.

parameters.name: addWorkflow
parameters.description: Adds one or more workflows by ID to the available pool of workflows for the agent. You can get a list of workflows by calling the listTool tool.

assignments.name: response
assignments.value: =Expected workflow to be available but not yet added. You can only use workflows which have been added to the available pool. Use the listWorkflows tool to see available workflows.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful assistant who only uses workflows to answer questions and perform tasks.
* When asked to complete a task, you will assume there is a workflow which you can use. Do not generate custom scripts or raw commands - use a workflow isntead.
* Only use the available active workflows as listed using the "listWorkflows" tool.
* Workflows returned by "listWorkflows" tool are active in the pool and do not need to be added again.
* Always ask the user before adding workflows to the availble pool.
* You do not need to confirm each step with the user when executing workflows.
* When executing the workflow, the required parameters schema for it is listed in the workflow's profile. To get this profile, use the listWokflows tool.
* If no available workflows are suitable and you are not able to complete the task, simply let the user know.
* Do not search for workflows in the directory unless the user requests.

assignments.name: parameters

options.systemMessage:
=You are a data extraction assistant.

Your task is to extract credit card spend information from the email content provided. The email may or may not be related to a credit card transaction. Follow the instructions below carefully.

---

### Tasks:

1. **Detect if the email is a credit card spend notification.**

2. If it **is**, extract the following fields:
   - `date`: Date of transaction (format: `MM-DD-YYYY`)
   - `amount`: Final amount in INR (either original INR or converted)
   - `currency`: Original currency of the transaction (e.g., INR, USD, EUR)
   - `card_last4`: Last 4 digits of the card used
   - `card_label`: Label of the card based on card number (see mapping)
   - `merchant`: Merchant or location of the spend
   - `actual_rate`: Amount in original currency (set to `null` if currency is INR)
   - `conversion_rate`: Exchange rate used to convert the currency to INR (set to `null` if currency is INR)
   - `success`: `true` if data is found, `false` if not a credit card spend email

3. If the **currency is not INR**, use the following tool:
   - Tool name: `search_currency_rate`
   - Purpose: Get current exchange rate from original currency to INR
   - Input format:
     ```json
     {
       "from_currency": "<currency_code>",
       "to_currency": "INR"
     }
     ```

4. If **no relevant spend info is found**, return all fields as `null` except `success: false`.

---

### Card Mapping:
- If card ends with **1012**, set `card_label` to `"CC - Lakshit ICICI MMT"`
- If card ends with **4007**, set `card_label` to `"CC - Lakshit ICICI Coral"`
- Otherwise, use `"Unknown Card"`

---

### Output Format:
```json
{
  "date": "MM-DD-YYYY or null",
  "amount": number or null,
  "currency": "INR or original currency or null",
  "card_last4": "xxxx or null",
  "card_label": "CC - Lakshit ICICI MMT / CC - Lakshit ICICI Coral / Unknown Card / null",
  "merchant": "Merchant Name or null",
  "actual_rate": number or null,
  "conversion_rate": number or null,
  "success": true or false
}

json.snippet: Dear Customer, Your ICICI Bank Credit Card XX1012 has been used for a transaction of USD 20.00 on Aug 12, 2025 at 06:28:10. Info: OPENAI *CHATGPT SUBSCR. The Available Credit Limit on your card is INR
json.Subject: Transaction alert for your ICICI Bank Credit Card

nodes.name: Append row in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.jsCode: const vr=/(?:n8n@|v)\s*([0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+)/i; for(const item of $input.all()) { const d=item.json; const m=d.title.match(vr); if(m) d.version=m[1]; const t=d.title.toLowerCase(); if(t.includes('fix')) d.tags.push('fix'); if(t.includes('feat')) d.tags.push('feature'); } return $input.all();

const seen=new Set(); const out=[]; for(const item of $input.all()) { if(!seen.has(item.json.id)) { seen.add(item.json.id); out.push(item); } } return out.length ? out : [{json:{message:'No items'}}];

const cutoff=new Date(Date.now()-7*24*60*60*1000); const out=[]; for(const item of $input.all()) { if(item.json.publishedAt && new Date(item.json.publishedAt)>=cutoff) out.push(item); else if(!item.json.publishedAt) out.push(item); } return out.length ? out : [{json:{message:'No recent items'}}];
